body:
Comment 3 by **evan.christopher.davis**: 
evan@evan-desktop:~/go/src/lib9$ cd ~/go/src/lib9
evan@evan-desktop:~/go/src/lib9$ pwd
/home/evan/go/src/lib9
evan@evan-desktop:~/go/src/lib9$ echo $(pwd)
/home/evan/go/src/lib9
evan@evan-desktop:~/go/src/lib9$ echo $(/home/evan/go/src/lib9)
bash: /home/evan/go/src/lib9: is a directory

evan@evan-desktop:~/go/src/lib9$ 

I didn't modify Go at all after I pulled it from the Mercurial repository. I don't 
recall making any symlinks to or from anything in my home directory other than one 
between Django and /usr/local/bin/.

I tried this on another computer (also running Ubuntu 9.04) and got the same error 
message.
